intro: Dicerandra frutescens subsp. thinicola, commonly known as the slender dicerandra, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant prefers well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its medicinal properties. The subspecies thinicola is distinguished by its more slender growth form compared to other subspecies of Dicerandra.
